intro: Quercus petraea f. pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sessile oak, is a shrub-like form of the sessile oak. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are often slightly hairy on the underside. This variety typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showing adaptability to poor soils. The leaves are usually 5–10 cm long and have a distinctive pinnatifid shape, with shallow lobes. It is a hardy plant often found in mountainous regions across Europe.
